intro: Magnolia yulan, commonly known as the Japanese magnolia, is a deciduous tree native to Japan and Korea. It is characterized by its large, showy, white or pinkish-white flowers that bloom in early spring before the leaves emerge. The plant has simple, alternate, ovate to elliptic leaves that turn yellow in autumn. Its flowers have a subtle fragrance and are often used in traditional Japanese gardens. The tree typically grows to a height of 8–15 meters and prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sun.
